snippet: Much of the early research - and many of the early pronouncements - on social media seemed calculated to make parents terrified of an emerging technology that many of them did not understand as well as their children did.
abstract: Much of the early research - and many of the early pronouncements - on social media seemed calculated to make parents terrified of an emerging technology that many of them did not understand as well as their children did.
lead_paragraph: In today's 18 and Under column, Dr. Perri Klass, a pediatrician, makes the case that we sometimes overreact to concerns about teenagers, texting and other social media.

headline.main: Worrying Less About Teens, Texting and Social Media
